snippet: A Moscow court ruled on Wednesday that two women accused of participating in a “punk prayer service” against Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin must remain in detention until April 24.
abstract: Moscow court rules that Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova, who were accused of participating in a feminist demonstration against Prime Minister Vladimir V Putin must remain in pretrial detention for now; they were arrested on the eve of the presidential election and face up to seven years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A Moscow court ruled on Wednesday that two women accused of participating in a “punk prayer service” against Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin must remain in detention until April 24.

headline.main: Russia: 2 Arrested After Band’s Protest at Cathedral to Remain Jailed
headline.print_headline: Russia: 2 Arrested After Band’s Protest At Moscow Cathedral to Remain Jailed
